medical_history.chief_complaint: Clinically diagnosed classic Bartter syndrome with hypocalciuria.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 presented symptoms at 4 months of age, including poor feeding and failure to thrive, leading to hospital referral. Patient 2 presented at 6 months with fever and marked failure to thrive. Both patients experienced electrolyte disturbances. Patient 1's symptoms included continued failure to thrive, salt craving, and polydipsia, while Patient 2 started treatment with oral potassium and indomethacin around 3 years 6 months of age, leading to catch-up growth.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1 has a history of failure to thrive, hypokalemia, and mental retardation. Patient 2 has a history of growth hormone therapy due to impaired growth hormone secretion. Both are diagnosed with Bartter syndrome and have demonstrated significant electrolyte imbalances.
medical_history.family_history: Patient 1's older sister displayed similar symptoms. Patient 2's parents do not exhibit any apparent clinical symptoms.
